clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 2 Trial to Evaluate 18-Methoxycoronaridine Efficacy, Safety and Tolerability in Cutaneous Leishmaniasis Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Randomized, Unicentric Clinical Trial With Dose Scaling for Safety, Tolerability and Efficacy Assessment of 18-Methoxycoronaridine Administered to Cutaneous Leishmaniasis Patients

collaborator.agency: Evandro Chagas National Institute of Infectious Disease

brief_summary.textblock: It is a randomized phase II clinical study, unicentre aimed to evaluate the tolerability, safety and efficacy of 18-Methoxyoronaridine as a candidate of tegumentary leishmaniasis treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Lesion Reduction and Re-epithelization - Definitive Cure
primary_outcome.description: complete epithelization of all ulcers and complete disappearance of inflammatory hardening of all lesions at 6 months at the follow-up visit.

primary_outcome.measure: Lesion Reduction and Re-epithelization - Partial Cure
primary_outcome.description: incomplete epithelialization or incomplete regression of inflammatory hardening of one or more lesions, and without the appearance of new lesions. Apparent cure: complete epithelization of all ulcers and regression ≥ 70% of the inflammatory hardening of all lesions.

Any of the following topics as clinical failure: residual readers with the presence of non-GiemsaDiff-Quick print parasites, or the appearance of new lesions or ≥ 20% increase or no improvement of lesions previously documented.

intervention.description: Drug under evaluation for leishmaniasis treatment
